learning_outcomes.description: Define the common challenges with soils, including mechanics, hydraulics, and environmental issues.
Explain the typical features of the stress-strain behaviour of clays and sands
Select the appropriate laboratory and field experiments to calibrate material models.
Explain the critical assumptions for the continuum representation of the mechanical behaviour of materials.
Define the issues with soft and expansive soils.
Explain the hydraulic principles of unsaturated soils.
Analyse the impact of unsaturated soil mechanics in geotechnical engineering.
Understand electrical resistivity tomography for soil characterisation.
Explain the main concepts of geophysics and its benefit to soil mechanics.

assessments.task_description:
Solution of a project-like calculation problem involving, but not limited to, the following topics: (a) Constitutive relationships parameterization and analysis, (b) Laboratory testing, and (c) Critical state soil mechanics.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Solution of a project-like calculation problem involving, but not limited to, the following topics: (a) Common challenges with soils, (b) Analysis of unsaturated and problematic soils, (c) Soft and problematic soils, and (d) Physical principles and hydraulics.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The final exam will include short answer, short essay and problem solving questions about materials modelling, unsaturated soils, and geophysics.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

A set of tutorials will be defined in three parts covering: (1) materials modelling, (2) unsaturated soils, and (3) geophysics.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07, L08, L09
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorials A set of tutorials will be defined in three parts covering: (1) materials modelling, (2) unsaturated soils, and (3) geophysics.

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction

Introduction to Advanced Soil Mechanics

Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction Introduction to Advanced Soil Mechanics

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 4(29 Jul - 18 Aug)
learning_activities.topic:
Continuum mechanics and materials modelling

Fundamentals of materials modelling and testing. Introduction to continuum mechanics, elasticity, and plasticity.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Continuum mechanics and materials modelling Fundamentals of materials modelling and testing. Introduction to continuum mechanics, elasticity, and plasticity.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 5 To Week 8(19 Aug - 15 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Unsaturated soils

Introduction to unsaturated, soft, and expansive soils. Physical principles, hydraulics, and case studies.


Learning outcomes: L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Unsaturated soils Introduction to unsaturated, soft, and expansive soils. Physical principles, hydraulics, and case studies.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 9 To Week 12(16 Sep - 20 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Geophysics

Introduction to geophysics, electrical resistivity tomography for soil characterisation, induced polarization, and complex conductivity.


Learning outcomes: L08, L09
learning_activities.topic_description: Geophysics Introduction to geophysics, electrical resistivity tomography for soil characterisation, induced polarization, and complex conductivity.
